docx_questions.text: Most cardiovascular developments occur between which weeks of gestation?
The function of the foramen ovale in a fetus allows what to occur?
options: Blood flow from the umbilical cord

docx_questions.text: At birth, which statement is true?
options: Systemic resistance and pulmonary resistance fall.
Gas exchange shifts from the placenta to the lung.
Systemic resistance falls and pulmonary resistance rises.
Systemic resistance and pulmonary resistance rise.

docx_questions.text: When does systemic vascular resistance in infants begin to increase?
options: uring the beginning stage of labor
Once the placenta is removed from circulation

docx_questions.text: Which event triggers congenital heart defects that cause acyanotic congestive heart failure?
Older children with an unrepaired cardiac septal defect experience cyanosis because of which factor?
Which congenital heart defects occur in trisomy 13, trisomy 18, and Down syndrome?
options: oarctation of the aorta (COA) and pulmonary stenosis (PS)
Tetralogy of Fallot and persistent truncus arteriosus
Ventricular septal defect (VSD) and patent ductus arteriosus (PDA)

docx_questions.text: An infant has a continuous machine-type murmur best heard at the left upper sternal border throughout systole and diastole, as well as a bounding pulse and a thrill on palpation. These clinical findings are consistent with which congenital heart defect?

An infant has a crescendo-decrescendo systolic ejection murmur located between the second and third intercostal spaces along the left sternal border. A wide fixed splitting of the second heart sound is also found. These clinical findings are consistent with which congenital heart defect?

An infant has a loud, harsh, holosystolic murmur and systolic thrill that can be detected at the left lower sternal border that radiates to the neck. These clinical findings are consistent with which congenital heart defect?
Where can coarctation of the aorta (COA) be located?
options: etween the origin of the aortic arch and the bifurcation of the aorta in the lower abdomen
etween the origin of the aortic arch and the origin of the first intercostal artery

docx_questions.text: Classic manifestations of a systolic ejection murmur heard at the left interscapular area, cool mottled skin on the lower extremities but hypertension noted in the upper extremities, and decreased or absent femoral pulse are indicative of an older child with which congenital defect?
What is the initial manifestation of aortic coarctation observed in a neonate?
Which compensatory mechanism NisUsRpSoInNtGanTeBo.CuOslMy used by children diagnosed with tetralogy of Fallot to relieve hypoxic spells?
An infant diagnosed with a small patent ductus arteriosus (PDA) would likely exhibit which symptom?
What is the most common cause of chronic sustained hypertension observed only in a newborn?
Which condition is consistent with the cardiac defect of transposition of the great vessels?
options: The aorta arises from the right ventricle.
The pulmonary trunk arises from the right ventricle.
The right ventricle pumps blood to the lungs.

docx_questions.text: Which scenario describes total anomalous pulmonary venous return?
options: The foramen ovale closes after birth.
Pulmonary venous return is to the right atrium.
Pulmonary venous return is to the leftatrium.
The left atrium receives oxygenated blood.

docx_questions.text: Which heart defect produces a systolic ejection murmur at the right upper sternal border that transmits to the neck and left lower sternal border?
Which heart defect produces a systolic ejection click at the upper left sternal border with a thrill palpated at the upper left sternal border?
What is the suggested mean bloodNpUrResSsINurGeTfBo.rCaOnM8- to 9-year-old child?
